meanings.definition: A small freshwater or marine fish with sharp spines along its back.
meanings.sent1: I saw a stickleback swimming in the pond.
meanings.sent2: The stickleback darted away when I approached the water.
meanings.sent3: The stickleback seemed to be playing hide-and-seek with the other fish.
meanings.sent4: The stickleback's spines were like tiny swords protecting it from predators.
meanings.sent5: The stickleback's shimmering scales caught the sunlight, making it a beautiful sight.

meanings.definition: To hesitate or be unwilling to proceed.
meanings.sent1: I tend to stickleback when it comes to making important decisions.
meanings.sent2: She sticklebacks whenever she has to speak in front of a crowd.
meanings.sent3: Don't stickleback now; we're almost at the finish line!
meanings.sent4: His fear of failure made him stickleback from taking risks.
meanings.sent5: The team cannot afford to stickleback in the final moments of the game.
